item.title: Gary add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Gary add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Gary add a quote by kurt vonnegut
item.description: "If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph: THE ONLY PROOF HE NEEDED FOR THE EXISTENCE OF GOD WAS MUSIC" -- kurt vonnegut

item.title: Gary add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Where do I get my ideas from? You might as well have asked that of Beethoven. He was goofing around in Germany like everybody else, and all of a sudden this stuff came gushing out of him. It was music. I was goofing around like everybody else in Indiana, and all of a sudden stuff came gushing out. It was disgust with civilization." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Gary add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Gary add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Gary add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Happiness consists in realizing it is all a great strange dream" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Gary add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Everything will come in due course, if you have the gumption to wait for it." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Gary add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Gary add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "True, we love life, not because we are used to living, but because we are used to loving. There is always some madness in love, but there is also always some reason in madness." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Gary add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "People with no morals often considered themselves more free, but mostly they lacked the ability to feel or love." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I couldn't get myself to read the want ads. The thought of sitting in front of a man behind a desk and telling him that I wanted a job, that I was qualified for a job, was too much for me. Frankly, I was horrified by life, at what a man had to do simply in order to eat, sleep, and keep himself clothed. So I stayed in bed and drank. When you drank the world was still out there, but for the moment it didn't have you by the throat." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Gary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gary add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart. The really great men must, I think, have great sadness on earth." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Gary add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "Silence is worse; all truths that are kept silent become poisonous." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Gary add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "A man is rich in proportion to the number of things which he can afford to let alone." -- Henry David Thoreau
